title: VEHICLE SCHEDULING DEVICE AND METHOD FOR TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS
summary: <SOH> BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE DRAWINGS <EOH>Implementations of the present technology will now be described, by way of example only, with reference to the attached figures. FIG. 1 illustrates a system diagram of a transportation system in accordance with aspects of the disclosure. FIG. 2 illustrates a system diagram of a transportation system with a vehicle scheduling device in a distribution center in accordance with aspects of the disclosure. FIG. 3 illustrates a block diagram of a vehicle scheduling device in accordance with an implementation. FIG. 4 illustrates a block diagram of a transportation system in accordance with an implementation. FIG. 5 illustrates a system diagram of a transportation system in accordance with an implementation. FIG. 6A illustrates a flowchart illustrating a vehicle scheduling method. FIG. 6B illustrates a diagram of Genetic algorithm (GA) in accordance with an implementation. FIG. 6C illustrates another diagram of Genetic algorithm (GA) in accordance with an implementation. FIG. 6D illustrates another flowchart illustrating a vehicle scheduling method. FIG. 7 illustrates a system diagram of a distribution system in accordance with an implementation. FIG. 8 is an application interface of a vehicle scheduling device. FIG. 9 is another application interface of a vehicle scheduling device. detailed-description description="Detailed Description" end="lead"?
abstract: A vehicle scheduling device includes a processor configured to perform at least one objective function. An input interface communicatively is coupled to the processor and configured to accept input of a scheduling data, and the scheduling data includes at least one door environment parameter, an operational parameter, and dynamic information. A computer readable medium coupled to the processor and configured to receive the scheduling data, the computer readable medium further includes instructions stored therein, upon when executed by the processor, causes the processor to perform operations to generate an optimal scheduling plan. A display device is coupled to the processor and configured to output a visual representation of the optimal scheduling plan.
